results.adx_keywords: Art;Performance Art;Nudism and Nudity;Museums;Abramovic, Marina;Royal Academy of Arts;Museum of Modern Art;London (England)
results.title: Marina Abramovic Relents, and Adapts a Provocative Piece for Today
results.abstract: In a new retrospective, a work that shocked audiences in the 1970s has been altered to suit contemporary mores. “Really, the smart thing to do is compromise,” the artist said.

media.caption: For a presentation of Marina Abramovic’s 1977 work “Imponderabilia” at the Royal Academy in London, an alternative doorway is provided if visitors do not wish to pass close by two naked performers.
media.copyright: David Parry/Royal Academy of Arts, London

results.title: Target, Citing Theft, to Close Nine Stores
results.abstract: The retailer will close locations in New York, San Francisco, Seattle and Portland, saying its business had been hurt and the safety of employees and customers was at risk.

media.caption: The Target store in East Harlem is one of the locations the retailer will permanently close on Oct. 21.

media.caption: David McCallum as Illya Kuryakin on “The Man From U.N.C.L.E.” His part was originally meant to be small, but he soon became a fixture of the series — and, somewhat to his annoyance, a sex symbol.

results.title: Barbara Mullen, Who Rode Unorthodox Beauty to Modeling Fame, Dies at 96
results.abstract: With her 20-inch waist and gangly figure, she overcame early skepticism from editors to embody a new look in 1950s fashion.

media.caption: The model Barbara Mullen in a 1953 advertisement. By the early 1950s, beauty standards in the fashion industry had started to evolve, and Ms. Mullen was at the vanguard of that evolution.
